text:
Hi, Could somebody explain please what the following statement does and when it is necessary:
`isdefined(Base, :__precompile__) && __precompile__()`

elements.text: Hi, Could somebody explain please what the following statement does and when it is necessary:

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

Success, it has been cross posted <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/hi-could-somebody-explain-please-what-the-following-statement-does-and-when-it-is|to Discourse>. Keep and eye out on Discourse for responses and please add an answer there once you are satisfied with the solution so others can benefit as well. Happy debugging!
It checks if the `__precompile__` function exists in `Base` and then calls it. It should never be necessary since it is default.

elements.text: and then calls it. It should never be necessary since it is default.
